1. Cook the pasta until al dente.
2. Sauté garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
3. Add cream cheese, a splash of pasta cooking water, and Parmesan cheese. Stir well.
4. Drain the pasta and add it to the skillet.
5. Toss everything until well combined, adding more pasta water if needed.

1. Boil 1.5 cups of water.
2. Add Maggi noodles and cook until soft.
3. Stir in the Maggi masala.
4. Cook for 2 minutes.
5. Your Maggi noodles are ready to enjoy!

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Mix flour, sugar, and baking powder in a bowl.
3. In another bowl, cream butter and sugar together.
4. Add eggs, vanilla extract, and mix well.
5. Combine the wet and dry ingredients, then add milk until smooth.
6. Pour batter into a greased pan and bake for 30-35 minutes.

1. Mix flour, sugar, and baking powder in a bowl.
2. In another bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
3. Combine the wet and dry ingredients until smooth.
4. Heat a griddle and pour batter to form pancakes.
5. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.

Pizza Dough
Tomato Sauce
Mozzarella Cheese
Toppings of Choice (e.g., pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers)

1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
3. Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
4. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top and add your choice of toppings.
5. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.

1. Shape ground beef into patties and season with salt and pepper.
2. Grill or pan-fry the patties until cooked to your liking.
3. Toast the burger buns on the grill or in a toaster.
4. Assemble the burger with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and your choice of condiments.
5. Serve immediately.

1. Peel and cut potatoes into thin strips.
2. Soak the strips in water for at least 30 minutes, then pat dry.
3. Heat vegetable oil in a fryer or large pan.
4. Fry potatoes in batches until golden and crispy.
5. Drain on paper towels and season with salt, pepper, and any additional spices if desired.
